channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- App Connect Enterprise Certified Container
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- App Connect Enterprise Certified Container

item.title: CVE-2020-4785|2024-09-16T17:29:01.679Z -- ibm -- app%20connect%20enterprise%20certified%20container
item.description: IBM App Connect Enterprise Certified Container 1.0.0, 1.0.1, 1.0.2, 1.0.3, and 1.0.4 could allow a remote attacker to hijack the clicking action of the victim. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to hijack the victim's click actions and possibly launch further attacks against the victim. IBM X-Force ID: 189219.

item.title: CVE-2021-29759|2024-09-16T16:48:47.088Z -- ibm -- app%20connect%20enterprise%20certified%20container
item.description: IBM App Connect Enterprise Certified Container 1.0, 1.1, 1.2, and 1.3 could allow a privileged user to obtain sensitive information from internal log files. IBM X-Force ID: 202212.

item.title: CVE-2021-29906|2024-09-16T17:32:49.745Z -- ibm -- app%20connect%20enterprise%20certified%20container
item.description: IBM App Connect Enterprise Certified Container 1.0, 1.1, 1.2, 1.3, 1.4 and 1.5 could disclose sensitive information to a local user when it is configured to use an IBM Cloud API key to connect to cloud-based connectors. IBM X-Force ID: 207630.

item.title: CVE-2022-43915|2024-08-26T12:12:43.447Z -- ibm -- app%20connect%20enterprise%20certified%20container
item.description: IBM App Connect Enterprise Certified Container 5.0, 7.1, 7.2, 8.0, 8.1, 8.2, 9.0, 9.1, 9.2, 10.0, 10.1, 11.0, 11.1, 11.2, 11.3, 11.4, 11.5, 11.6, 12.0, and 12.1 does not limit calls to unshare in running Pods. This can allow a user with access to execute commands in a running Pod to elevate their user privileges.

item.title: CVE-2022-43915|2024-08-24T11:22:02.059Z -- ibm -- app%20connect%20enterprise%20certified%20container
item.description: IBM App Connect Enterprise Certified Container 5.0, 7.1, 7.2, 8.0, 8.1, 8.2, 9.0, 9.1, 9.2, 10.0, 10.1, 11.0, 11.1, 11.2, 11.3, 11.4, 11.5, 11.6, 12.0, and 12.1 does not limit calls to unshare in running Pods. This can allow a user with access to execute commands in a running Pod to elevate their user privileges.
